alert.note: Alert for Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 12:00AM CST until further notice by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Winston. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1200 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Haleyville, Lynn, Arley, Double Springs, Addison, Nauvoo, Houston Recreational Area, Winston Free State Barn, Corinth Rec Area, Moreland, Poplar Springs, Ashridge, Camp McDowell, Falls City, Smith Lake, Brushy Lake, Ashbank, Inmanfield, Helicon and Needmore.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
